snippet: Nearly 50 police officers were reported injured and 54 protesters were arrested after officers attempted to shut down unlicensed food vendors.
abstract: Hong Kong police confront protesters defending shutdown of unlicensed food vendors on first day of Lunar New Year, leaving dozens injured or arrested; unrest occurred in Mong Kok shopping and residential district, scene of several demonstrations in recent years.

byline.contributor: Patrick Boehler and Alan Wong contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Nearly 50 police officers were reported injured and 54 protesters were arrested after officers attempted to shut down unlicensed food vendors.

headline.main: Protesters and Police Clash at Lunar New Year Festivities in Hong Kong
headline.print_headline: Protesters and Police Clash at Lunar New Year Festivities in Hong Kong
